Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shailesh S
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel for the price I paid for deluxe room. I stayed here for 6 nights in the month of April, 2012. I was quite hesitate to book this hotel bacuase of bad reviews but now I'm proud of my decesion. Here is my summary. Highly friendly staff + great location + good free breakfast + free shuttle + very economical price + highly accomodative hotel management + excellent room service + good pool & SPA + walkable great restaurent and public transportations = Oustanding economical hotel. I must thanks Paula, Dimitri and Mohammed for their curtessy and helping nature. ...sharma

Reviews.Title: “Not guaranteed a room after making reservation”
Reviews.Author: Swravelo
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation over the phone with the hotel directly. Front desk agent insisted not to take my credit card information because my room would be waiting for me. Having a bad feeling I show expecting the worst. To my delight my room was given up to someone else and I was basically told to bad by the front desk agent.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed!”
Reviews.Author: Purceli
Reviews.Content: My family and I travelled down to Florida and were surprised when the hotel we had booked changed their minds about allowing pets (we had small dogs with us). Red Roof came to our rescue. The service was great and so were the people. After the first night, as per our request, they moved us down to the first floor but as an extra surprise they also upgraded us to a suite. The rooms were great for the price we paid and during the time we were there, they were in the process of cleaning out and upgrading the rooms (taking up the carpets etc.) so it looks like the next time we are there the rooms might be even better! But as of March 2012, the rooms were fairly clean, the beds were very nice and the amenities were very good. The pool and hot tub was very nice and great to have on a hot day. Plus the location was great! I would return to this location. The people were great and for the price the rooms were great. Don't expect 5 stars right now but it looks like they are working towards it.

Reviews.Title: “Staff & facility”
Reviews.Author: DJ P
Reviews.Content: From check in wih Desk Clerk Dimitri, Houskeeping with Alicia, to check out with Desk Clerk Sarah, one could not hope to find people who were kinder, more understanding, and eager to please as these three. All requests were treated as pleasures to fulfill. The facility is a good value for the money, begining to show it's age,the location favorable and convenient the rooms clean - but the Staff more than compensates for any perceived shortcoming. I'd go back again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Cheap place for a night”
Reviews.Author: Adventurer213
Reviews.Content: We stayed there one night so that we could have a little weekend holiday at Disney and it was great. The front desk was super nice and the room wasn't out of this world amazing, it was a motel room... and for what it was it did just great for a night out in Orlando. I liked it and will probably check it out again when we do it again. Another bonus is that there is a Pizza Hut across the parking lot from it so you can order a late night snack and just walk there to get it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 27nanc
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our trip to FL recently & had a very nice stay at Red Roof Inn, Kissimmee. Nice rooms, very friendly staff ! Loved the hot tub ! All the staff were helpful & friendly & special thanks to Kevin the manager.

Reviews.Title: “Smokey and dark”
Reviews.Author: THLe
Reviews.Content: I booked this place because they allow pets and it is close to Disney. I knew what to expect. Smokey, dark, dank, and dirty carpets. The staff was kind enough to advised us afterwards that we should have told them at we had pets with us and they would have put us in an location that wouldn't disturb other guest. I was glad I didn't because I would have been very afraid of what the other rooms may have looked like because my 2 little 5 lbs dogs only barks and house trained. Close to many restaurants and a supermarket is across the street. Walmart is about 1 mile away. If you are looking for a clean bed to sleep on, this is your place. Don't expect too much for a cheap room. If you are looking for an updated, clean room, come up with another $30-40/night.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: maciejpiotrowski
Reviews.Content: Very poor quality hotel. I was staying in this hotel last weekend for my Disney Parks vacation. We stayed for 3 nights. Here is my opinion. ROOM: Room smelled like bleach. Had to change it to 2nd floor. Smelly air in the other room too. Room had a dirty feeling. Dirty carpets. Not working cable. MOLD in the Bathroom. Hair dryer not properly attached to the wall. Just laying on the sink counter. BREAKFAST: Free danish, cereal, toast, apple and orange juice. There is a pool and jacuzzi there but I did not use it. I was afraid of catching some disease. LOCATION: Good location 10 min from the parks. PARKING: Just enough spaces. OK. PRICE: Good price. WOULD I RECOMMEND IT FOR A FRIEND: Definitely NO. Conclusion: If you just want to sleep overnight and do not care about esthetics of your hotel, this is a good place to stay. Otherwise, find another hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cheap, worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: Pete_LongIsland_NY
Reviews.Content: The location is great. 20 minutes from Disney with lots of restaurants and shopping nearby. The units are outdated and need some work. They are fairly clean but because they are so old, they seem less clean. The breakfast is free and very basic: cereal, small bagels, toast. Coffee is bad. Free wifi, but sketchy in rooms; good in lobby. Staff was very helpful and eager to please. If you get it for around $35 per night, you can't beat the value. If you pay the normal $69, then I would go someplace better. Definitely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “this is a Superior King room?”
Reviews.Author: ymdavila
Reviews.Content: upon check-in we were told that we would be upgraded to a Superior King room. The description of the Superior King stated that the room would include micro, fridge and coffeemaker. Upon entering the room, we saw a standard room with a king bed, no additional amenities We called the front desk and she told us that we were upgraded to a Superior with NO amenities! What a lie! we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for money you pay..Rooms overall good and breakfast poor. Very good location”
Reviews.Author: mario p
Reviews.Content: The hotel is overall good for short stay and expecially to visit Disney world.. There's a comfortable shuttle that takes you to the parks and back. Breakfast is poor,instead. Rooms are quite comfortable, not too clean but I can't complain..!! I stayed two night and it was not so bad! Internet connection has some problem but you can manage to navigate..

Reviews.Title: “Outdated Facility is cheap, but there is a reason why”
Reviews.Author: bostonzu
Reviews.Content: We needed a cheap place to crash after a bad experience with another chain caused us to change accommodations. We had an early flight and just wanted something basic to crash in for a few hours of sleep before flying home. The location wasn't bad as it was less than 10 minutes (driving) from Downtown Disney and only 20-25 minutes from the main airport in Orlando. The staff was friendly and that is the best thing I can say about our experience. We pre-booked a crib for our young child. Unfortunately, when we arrived they were all out (they had four in the system). The manager made a few calls and had his staff scour the place for a crib that might have been overlooked. What they found was one that had been vomited on and was otherwise disgusting (the vomit stain was still visible). They did there best to clean it up, but nothing would change it's appearance as if it had been pulled from a dump. At that point sanitary concerns took over and in the end we didn't use the crib. The staff gets credit for trying to find a solution, but they came up short with the final result. To be fair, they told us it was not in good shape before delivering it to our room late at night, but were surprised how bad it was. In the end, the location is convenient, staff is friendly and the price is reasonable, However, you must temper your expectations for the quality/cleanliness of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY, IT'S A NIGHTMARE”
Reviews.Author: 455Kate455
Reviews.Content: We spent only one night December 24, 2011. The first impression at the reception was not bad. But after opening the door of the room almost threw up from the terrible stench of mold. Most of the ceiling was covered with mildew and stains. Bathroom dirty and disgusting, mold everywhere. Old, yellowed towels. almost all carpet in the room was damp and sticky (I suspect that the reason for this is that stench in the room). Generally, all the equipment room was very old and damaged. But that's not all. We thought: ok, this is only one night, it is already late, somehow hold out. We decided to sit in the Jacuzzi on the outside. when he approached, I felt a strong smell of chlorine, but I thought ok, used it to disinfect. I managed to withstand just a few minutes, I started to bake my eyes and skin. When I went out with whirlpool saw with horror that MY BATHING SUIT DISCOLORED DUE TO MASSIVE DOSES OF BLEACH IN THE WATER!!!!!!!. simply could not believe it. I went immediately to the front desk and showed what happened. I was so angry that I told the manager to call immediately, but it just was not him. Receptionist (Amid?, Sorry, I do not remember the name) called to him and started talking in a foreign language. When I asked to speak in English because I want to know the content of the conversation, rolled his eyes and looked at me like an idiot. This place is terrible, dirt, grime and dirt again. STAY AWAY, IT'S A WORST HOTEL EVER

Reviews.Title: “Expedia guest......... Be careful”
Reviews.Author: cchavaz
Reviews.Content: I made reservation online (Expedia). Actually I was attracked by VERY LOW RATES, and good reviews ( I think staff is writing reviews by thenselves), I reached at hotel by 2:45 pm, and ask Demetri (Manager) for check in. He replied that check in time is 3 pm, before 3, I have to pay for 1 extra night (REALLY?????), He took my Credit Card and charged me $33.89 for NOTHING :( Later I asked to have Micro wave and fridge in the room, and Manager told me that In order to get Micro wave and Fridge I have to pay $15 extra for each night. My family was very upset and they were mad at me, because I was the one who had chosen the RED ROOF KISSIMMEE for our family vocation. I requested if they can cancel my reservation (because I cannot pay more), they informed me that even if I cancel my reservation, they wont refund me anything. it was non refundable reservation made by Expedia. Later I contacted Expedia, but they told me that Expedia reservations are refundable. ( Shame on you Mr Manager) I stayed there for a week and paid $135 more then the amount I paid online ( EXPEDIA) to make reservation. Please be very careful, they are just attracting people with discounted rates, in fact they are charging about $50m - $60 a night for the 1 star hotel. you may contact me anytime via email adkison24943@aol.com.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go to this place unless you are on tight budget”
Reviews.Author: sachin s
Reviews.Content: It was horrible experience to stay at Red Roof Inn on my recent trip. Staff was very good, location is amazing but the rooms and overall hotel building is in very terrible shape. The room carpets are sticky and dirty, towels were ages old, Bed and blankets were horrible. There is a strange and dirty stinking smell in the room. Every time you return to room you have to face it and I was regretting having booked and prepaid for this hotel. If you really want to spend some quality time on vacation consider a better hotel as it is most important part of trip where you will recharge yourself after hectic sightseeing schedule.

Reviews.Title: “Very old and mean workers.”
Reviews.Author: lone_knight_watcher
Reviews.Content: Worker at check in was rude and did not make us feel welcome. She seemed to be in her own little world and not work. The room is out dated as is the whole hotel. The bathroom had mold all over the walls and ceiling. The light cover was broken. The breakfeast was worst then the people i jail get. I checked my account and found they over charged me... Do yourself a favor and find somewhere else to stay. This is skid row!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: SiddMoras
Reviews.Content: I really cant complain. The price makes it worthwhile. Nothing really wrong apart from the old carpet.

Reviews.Title: “Needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: bri019
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were traveling with our dog and tried Red Roof Kissimmee, since they are one of the few hotel chains who don't charge you for bringing your pet (La Quinta and Motel 6 being the other 2 I know of.) Hotel was dirty, and in need of updating. I felt so strongly that I took the survey sent to me after my stay. I was impressed that the manager followed up and apologized for not meeting my expectations, and that they would take steps to fix the issues indicated. I will stick with La Quinta when traveling w/ the pet.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: christopwater
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our trip to WDW. It's cheap. It's also in a good location. Near everything. Parking was OK. The pool was great. NO BUGS. Beds were made everyday. New towels daily. Awesome costumer service. All in all it was a nice place to stay except for the very dirty carpet. So dirty that we didn't let our 11 month old crawl on the floor. Carpets could use a deep cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME!!!”
Reviews.Author: SunnySmiles66
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Southwest when I booked my airline tickets and rental car. First thing I did after booking was read the reviews on Trip Advisor. Of course you get some good & some bad so I was open minded to find out for myself...Big Mistake!!! I'm a very easy spirited person & not a picky bone in my body, besides we only needed a place to sleep. The place didn't look bad when we pulled up (My younger Sis & Mother), neither did the front counter. The only thing noticed was the super strong smell of Chlorine in the dirty pool (as per my mother) but we weren't planning on swimming so no big deal. The guy (Amid?) can't remember his name, was very courteous. He asked us to wait one moment while he went to check the room. He came back & handed us the key. I felt all was well. However, as soon as you opened the door (Room 108) you immediately smelled the mold. As you walked in the room, you could see it EVERYWHERE!!! No joke. We turned around & told Amid we couldn't stay in that room. My chest as well as my Sister's was hurting from breathing in that strong odor. He told us he had one more room upstairs (Room 224) so we took the key & gave it another try. No mold but it smelled of Alcohol and urine (as my mother put it) and the bathroom pure urine. The smell was Horrible. At this point we were DONE!!! We went back and told him we are leaving. He apologized and gave us a cancellation # but said we would have to call to get our refund. It was late (close to 11pm) so he offered us the room for free stating that we would not be able to find a room anywhere else for the night. We declined! Not even for FREE!!! That's how Terrible the rooms were. We drove a few minutes down the street & stayed at Orlando Vista Hotel. What a BIG difference with less than $25 more per night. My advice: Spend the extra $ to ensure your safety as well as your health. A good night's sleep is priceless...in our case, just a few dollars more. Please, of all the reviews you read, Do not go to this Hotel. You WILL be sorry. Take care & May God Bless!!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Pet Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: uncsweetchic
Reviews.Content: We had visited Disney World 6 other times in the last year prior to this trip, half of those times staying at another nearby 'cheap' chain hotel. We needed to take our dog with us on this last-minute business trip, so we picked the Red Roof Inn and booked on hotels.com since it was the same price as the other affordable hotel that isn't pet friendly. We arrived and checked-in with no issues. The late-night attendant was very friendly throughout our stay and always took the time to say hey when he saw us passing by. When we arrived to our 2nd floor room, I noticed it was humid, even though the A/C was turned all the way up. So, we requested a new room and was moved next door with no questions asked. The A/C worked fine in the new room, plus it had the added bonus of a fridge, which was very handy. There is construction going on across the street on the back side of the hotel, but it didn't really bother us. I did notice that the pool side was a bit noisier at night because of Hwy 192 traffic. The room layout was typical for a budget hotel, but was still clean, although a bit damp. But you're in Florida, so that's to be expected in a hotel with outside entry. We didn't request housekeeping every day, but when we needed to just change out towels, the housekeeping staff was very quick to bring us new towels. We had to extend our stay last minute by a few days, so we booked a new reservation on Hotels.com for a extra days and had no problems getting the staff to allow us to remain in the same room. We didn't make use of the shuttle to any of the parks since we drove, so we can't really give a review on that. The breakfast was typical 'continental' breakfast style - packaged pastries/muffins, cereal, juice, and milk. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would stay there again if we needed to stay in the Kissimmee area again. Definitely recommend if you have a pet you're bringing with you and want to find a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A frequent Orlando area stop off.”
Reviews.Author: Eeyore63
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times in the last year. I have seen the renovations, as well as the good and the bad. I would not recommend this hotel for people without transportation. The shuttles are indeed inconvenient. Better to fork over the big bucks and stay on property. But, if you have a car (and a pet), this place is a good choice. You can drive past an outlet mall and a walmart to enter disney through World Drive. This takes you to Downtown Disney , and avoids a lot of traffic. Turning to the right gets you onto I drive, which is convenient to Sea World, and Universal (and another outlet mall). You can avoid I-4 altogether, which is a plus. Get a micro/fridge if staying more than 1 night as there is a grocery store within walking distance. I book directly through the Red Roof site. I paid less than $32 before taxes for my most recent stay. There is a problem with dampness in some rooms, at least on the first floor which I prefer. I always check the room before unloading. I had to move both on this stay and my previous stay in May (not reviewed). The night clerk, Dmitri, was helpful both times. My second room was clean. This last time, it was an accessible room with a king bed and a huge bathroom. They must be getting new linens as drapes were green, and spread was red. I don't care as long as they're clean, which they were. The tub in this room needed refinishing, but was also clean. Hot water was fine in the strong shower. The pool area is large and pool was clean. Spa is in a dark corner, and sometimes is pg rated, but kids should not be in the pool area alone anyway. Breakfast is standard packaged muffins & danish, boxed cereals, milk, juice & coffee. Lobby area has a sofa and high dining tables, which have been added since my first stay a few years ago. I have been making frequent trips with my dog through Florida. This hotel is my choice for a clean place to sleep, but I have also used it when visiting parks.

Reviews.Title: “Not clean, Mold, shuttle not what it seems, workers were nice”
Reviews.Author: DPReagan
Reviews.Content: I don’t understand some of these reviews. Maybe we had the worst room in the entire hotel, but it sounds like they were on an entirely different property. I often check the reviews on TripAdvisor and now strongly feel you should check how active a reviewer is on here. If they have just one review, be careful, I fear these may be paid, friends of the owners, or employees bumping the property up. Two friends and I planned a quick weekend to the Universal parks a week prior, so we did not do a lot of research ahead of time on where we would be staying. We only needed two things; a room to sleep at night and a shuttle that took us back and forth to the parks. Upon arriving at the hotel we notice a large amount of people just milling about, I assumed they might be waiting for the shuttles also. The lobby picture on this site is not true to reality, doctored or taken right after remodeling (as is the picture of the front of the building.) We had arrived around noon, so we were early for check-in. The front desk clerk was very polite and accommodating. He said our room wasn’t ready but would do his best to get us in a room quickly; the lobby was full of people just hanging out so there was nowhere to stand let alone sit. We only needed to wait about 20 minutes. The first problem we had was the shuttle. We booked through Expedia and on their site they had that this location offered free shuttles to and from the park. What needs to be noted is that this shuttle leaves once and returns only once-no back and forth throughout the day. The shuttle to Universal leaves at 9:05 am, the park opens at 8am so you automatically loose an hour. The returning shuttle pick up is at 7:15, the park closes at 10 so there you lose over 2.5 hours! If this was posted anywhere on this site or theirs we would have changed before we arrived, this was an essential part of our trip since we had no rental car. At this point we had already missed it and would need a cab to take us to the park- $40 from this location (we did use one, as you’ll read.) If you pay $80 a day to get back and forth using a cab you should just pay to stay at a nicer hotel that has around the clock shuttles. We were given our room cards and told we had the room right around the corner in front of the pool. The first thing that hit us as we opened the door was the smell; it smelled as if the man (who said he just cleaned up the room when we were in the lobby) had sprayed an entire can of Lysol. I could hardly breathe, and soon found why they had to spray. The entire ceiling is dotted with mold. The bathroom I can understand, and a little mold in a humid climate I can understand, but this was a lot. And while walking across the room I found the carpet was wet and squishy by the bathroom. I don’t understand how the previous reviewers are ok with this? I don’t want to stay in a room (even a very cheap one) that I will be breathing in this all night. And the reviews that say it’s a very clean hotel?! There was trash by the lobby door, wrappers by our room door and our room would not be described as clean (maybe the false sense of clean by the strong antiseptic smell?!) We even witnessed a woman doing what is best described as bathing her child in the pool right in front of our door (washcloth and all.) Another problem was the lack of security; we had a large window across the front that faced to pool, while we were in the room people were walking by just looking in. We closed the curtains but the condition of the door lock didn’t offer us any comfort. We quickly debated if it were worth asking for a different room opposed to moving hotels and agreed that if this is the room the clerk referred to us as “a great room with beautiful pool views,” we wouldn’t be happy with any. We quickly arranged for another place closer to the parks (this one was at least a half hour drive away) and returned to the lobby. The man at the desk was very nice about it and was pleasant through checkout. In the end we still had to pay for the room and our new hotel rooms, but it was worth it NOT to stay at the Red Roof Inn Kissimmee. I guess, in the end, you get what you pay for. Hopefully some of my photos will be posted.

Reviews.Title: “More bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: marivelmae
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel outweighs what you pay for this room. I booked my room threw Hotels.com and paid only $36.99 and it included a free continental breakfast. The two bed room was very decent for the price and it was so close to every theme park around including the water parks. But I cant stress enough the wonderful service from every worker in sight. If you plan on being at the parks all day long and just need a clean place to sleep, shower and have a little bit in the morning, than I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, esp with WIFI in rooms...minus the late check in and no towels for 2 hours.”
Reviews.Author: ohhector
Reviews.Content: Two main issues I had with this place: 1) I get there at 3pm, check in time (which is already an hour later than most other hotels in this area) and they told me to come back in 30 minutes. Didn't even check my reservation, which means a lot of the rooms were not ready. 2) I get to my room...no towels. I tell the guy at the front desk and he says I should have them in 5 minutes. 2 hours later, still no towels. I had to leave to a business meeting sweaty and nasty, due to not having any towels. (The lady actually brought them a few minutes before I walked out the door...but didn't bother knocking, just used her card key and walked right in as I was in the middle of dressing!) Having said that, the value of the hotel is otherwise good. Especially for the fact that there is WIFI INSIDE the rooms, something that is virtually non existent in the "el cheapo" Disney/orlando hotels. Service: sucky Bathroom: ok Bed: Not too bad Pillows: ok Decor: standard ugly "tropical" look from the 80s Cleanliness: pretty clean Location: It's not RIGHT next to the parks, but close enough...10 minute or so drive and you are inside disney property. McDonalds right across the street

Reviews.Title: “Moldy and Gross”
Reviews.Author: Karianne725
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I were scheduled to stay here on our girls trip to Universal Studios. It was chosen because of the price, we were only sleepig there. But when we arrived we knew immediately there was NO WAY we could stay there. The first thing we noticed were shady characters in the lobby. There was only one shuttle per day to our destination, which we had already missed, so we'd have to charter a cab. We checked into our room & were shocked to find mold all over the ceiling. All the furniture looked old & dirty. My friend quickly contacted her husband & he rebooked us in another hotel. The desk clerk was extremely understanding & gave us no problems when we wanted to leave. Overall, I'd say the little extra you'd have to pay to be closer to the parks is WELL worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location!”
Reviews.Author: Clipclop2
Reviews.Content: We wanted a simple place with great value and found it here. We plan to be gone all day anyway so why pay for extras we won't use. Cozy rooms, beds and bathroom. That is all we need. Tim checked us in and is very enthusiastic and attentive. I really appreciate the eye contact and body language of his concern for your stay. He is very friendly and polite. This place is a great value for your money and let's see how the week goes!

Reviews.Title: “we loved it! it was cheap and very pet friendly”
Reviews.Author: vanessagowan
Reviews.Content: at first i didnt know how the stay would be because when i first went in the room it smelt musty but it was the ac! the staff was very kind! it was cheap and there was no pet fee which was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money - Staff great!!!”
Reviews.Author: rangerwife81
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights so that son could meet friends at Disney. Close by to the Disney parks; easy drive but also shuttle if you wish to use it. Staff was great, helpful, polite. If you want resorts for $300-$400/night, stay at Disney but if you want quiet, etc. stay here. Also, when you just need a place to lay your head, this is it. Would stay again. *Stay away from the Pizza Hut in front of the hotel though; expensive and made son and I ill.*

Reviews.Title: “Really good value for money”
Reviews.Author: rhona321
Reviews.Content: This is a basic hotel but very good value for money. Easy to find and close to Disney. Rooms are clean and ideal if you are on a budget. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Red Roof Kissimmee”
Reviews.Author: Adnan69
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Red Roof Kissimmee for 5 days with my family. I had made reservation online and got very good rates, but still i was consern that dont know what kind of hotel it would be. Upon arrival, the property was nice and clean, and the front desk guy Dimitri was very helpful, even check in time was 3PM, but he checked us in by 10 AM and then we took shuttle to Disney attrections park, which is offered by the hotel. We stayed there for 5 days, and we enjoyed our stay very much, Management was very nice and cooprative and house keeping had done their job very well. I would love to recomend this hotel to everyone, Thanks Red Roof Kissimmee :)

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting! Will NEVER go back”
Reviews.Author: PINKS104
Reviews.Content: We knew the risk we were taking when we booked a $40 room in an older hotel. It was supposed to be "Superior King Bed Room" with a refrigerator and microwave. There was no refrigerator or microwave when we arrived. The very nice front desk clerk told us we could put anything we wanted into the refrigerator in the office. Who would put food in refrigerator that they couldn't see? GROSS. The smell in the room was SO BAD that after an hour in the room, I became physically ill. The entire carpet was wet, which is probably where the smell was coming from. We were moved into a room with double beds, which was uncomfortable for my husband and I. The smell in that room was barely tolerable, but I fell asleep with a wet rag over my face because it was so late that we didn't think we would be able to find another hotel. The next morning, I asked for a refund for the price difference between the room we stayed in and the room I had PAID for ($10 for the refrigerator/microwave and $10 for the room). The best the manager would do was a 10% discount, which wasn't even close to the price difference in the rooms. We even had to jump through hoops for that small amount. IT'S NOT WORTH THE SMALL SAVINGS YOU WILL HAVE! Spend a few extra dollars and avoid this disgusting hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, clean rooms, wonderful price.”
Reviews.Author: AnthonyAshby
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for our trip to the Disney and Universal parks. Not a fancy four star resort but the room was quiet, clean, and perfect for relaxing a bit and catching some sleep before another day at the parks. I can't see spending a ton of cash for a resort when your going to be in the theme parks all day. The staff was friendly, helpful, and did everything in their power to make sure our stay was comfortable. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “IT SURPASSED OUR EXPECTATIONS! GREAT STAY! WE WILL BE BACK!!!”
Reviews.Author: nana20041984
Reviews.Content: Our price for lodging was so low that I didn't expect this RedRoof Inn to be so special. The staff couldn't have been more friendly or helpful. Our room was nice and clean and we were in a very quiet area. The pool was clean and fun to use. The location is very close to Disney World, as well as many places to eat and shop. This is the perfect place to enjoy your vacation without spending those "MICKY MOUSE" prices, if you know what I mean. So if you are coming to Kissimmee try this very nice Red Roof Inn, I promise you will be happy, then you will be able to go to the great but hideously overpriced famous mouse resort.

Reviews.Title: “Red Roof Inn Kissimmee. An average hotel for a below average price!”
Reviews.Author: jbdusf
Reviews.Content: This hotel is average. Nothing special. Basic rooms. Nice pool. Close to Disney. What makes this hotel a great option is the price. Paid 35 per night on Memorial Day weekend. How can you go wrong? If you need a hotel that is perfect, stay away. If you can deal with an average room and want a great deal, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Has gone down hill and would not stay again.”
Reviews.Author: dbako
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Red Roof a few years ago and were expecting the same great room as before. It has defiantly gone down hill since then. It was not the same at all and needs to be refurbished. The room was smelly and everything was damp and musty, especially the carpet. The bathroom had mold growing in the cracks of the tub. We won't be staying there again. One the plus side, the internet was secure and free.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Stam55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on May 16, 2011 for one night. In the morning we checked out and left for Disney Parks. Few hours later my wife start scratching - she had at least 20 bites all over her legs. I checked online and can positively say that was bed bugs bites. I hope they didn't get into my luggage or clothes. Do yourself a favor and find a different hotel. There are more reports for bed bugs infestation at this property - just search online. I'm sorry I didn't check before booking

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Martinitraveller
Reviews.Content: This is an obvious good choice when you spend most of the time outside the hotel doing theme parks or having a day trip. It's great to sleep in, have a shower and a simple breakfast (cereals, milk, apple/ orange juice and some pastries), not more than that. So for me and my wife it was great value for money as we did just that. It's true that the rooms aren't very spacious but the bed was huge and very comfy, we heard no noises during the night and to avoid the odd smell, just close the bathroom door! The pool is small but you have so much to do and see that you will barely use it! The staff is excellent, providing you informations and services on everything you can think of. So overall I recommend this to couples, young and old alike, and to families with 1-2 children, it's an amazing value. Regarding the shuttles there is usually one at 7:30 am to the Disney World Main Transportation Center and another one at 12:30am. Return times differ depending from where are you returning but usually are between 7pm and 10pm. As for Universal Studios the shuttles leave a litlle bit later at 9am and 2pm and returns are more or less the same as for Disney. There are also shuttles to Sea World. If you prefer to get a taxi, you should pay 20-25 usd to go to either Disney or Universal. More than that and you are being ripped off. If you rent a car, dont forget that you need to pay parking in any of the parks- 14 usd on Disney and 15 usd on Universal Studios. If you want to go to do some shopping and find many restaurants, then International Drive is a good place not very far that would cost you 10usd to get there (depending on where you want to start)- My suggestions are Boston Read Lobster with their amazing and delicious seafood buffet and Orland Premium Outlets for great bargains on premium brands. Very nice places to have dinner and fun are Downtown Disney and Universal's City Wwalk with nice themed restaurants, but these are a little bit more distant than International Drive and usually making a reservation in advance is better. Try the Hard Rock Cafe in the City Walk and the T-Rex or Rainforest Café in Downtown Disney... abslolutely flawless. As a final information let me tell you that a taxi to the international airport of Orlando (MCO- Sanford) mustn't cost you more than 60 usd. Enjoy Orlando and its surroundings, its really a fantastic area!

Reviews.Title: “Not what Expected”
Reviews.Author: NMONPR
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel. The minute we open the door, we wanted to leave, the room smelled horrible, like musty, carpets were humid ( I did not take my sandals of for nothing after that). The bathroom was very small and either the water or the drains stunk like sulfer. Only two full size towels (when you checked in with two adults and two kids). One bed sheet was stained, I left the comforter on and the kids cover with their own blankets. We stayed because it was late 10:30pm and were very tired.

Reviews.Title: “priceworthy”
Reviews.Author: swedoc
Reviews.Content: Our family had a reservation for an apartment starting the day after our arrival to Orlando. The first night we then just needed a place to sleep, meaning that our requirements were limited. We arrived late at the hotel but the checkin went smoothly. The surroundings looked decent and the pool area was clean and looked inviting. The two-room suite was clean and roomy. The only things we did not like were the annoying loud sound from the AC and the dark murky carpet with suspicious "patina". In my view it is unclever to use full carpets in hotel rooms where the guests step in directly from outdoors. There should at least be a big doormat on the inside to put your shoes on. The complimentary wi-fi worked fine. The breakfast included cereals with milk, coffee and tea, juices and small sweet muffins. Naturally you get what you pay for, but in my view Red Roof Inn manages to give value for money. We would consider staying here again for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: OntarioFundaddy
Reviews.Content: They must write their own reviews we booked on expedia for $31 after reading reviews here. This is not an option to stay in to save some money. We couldn't stay here, the floors were wet and stinky, air conditioner didn't work. The guy was friendly but yikes there is no way I would feel safe here or comfortable. I came away with this, if my dogs kennel is more expensive than our hotel there might be an issue LOL. I was looking for a deal why I don't know but came away with having to find a hotel late at night after arriving for holidays with my family. We ended up at the holiday INN maingate for $79 a night and it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nastiest room I have ever been in.”
Reviews.Author: PaBigDog
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel before our cruise and the room was ok. Upon return from the cruise we wanted to stay one night before we headed home. Room #107 was terrible with a moldy ceiling and water that dripped from the room above onto you as you sat on the toilet. This hotel has gone down hill from when we used to stay with our kids when we went to disney world. Avoid this place like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Crooks - dont stay here.”
Reviews.Author: NickTM
Reviews.Content: I booked on Booking.com one month prior to my stay and then had to cancel due to the prospect of a British Airways strike. After having received a cancelation email from booking.com that I would not be charged (my actual check-in date was not for another month) - the hotel still deducted the first night from my Amex card. After contacting both Booking.com and the hotel directly with 6 emails I have yet to hear a response to credit back my account. Therefore my advice would be to stay away from both Booking.com and also Red Roof as they are just money grabbers without any care for customers. If you want a decent hotel in Orlando book directly with Extended Stay as I did this and had a hassle free, enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Sucks123
Reviews.Content: Pros. Staff is friendly. It is in a great location near a lot of stores. its good price wise. Near other hotels if u don't like this one there is other ones next to it more known ones. Cons. Found dead cockroach. bed sheets were not even washed. Only a few tv channels

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel with helpfull staff!”
Reviews.Author: minerva32
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in budget hotels in the area before. As the quality of accomodation, some hotels were better and some of them worse than Red Roof Inn. But none of them had the greater staff than this hotel has... The rooms look very old but not the furnitures actually. The bed spreads and towels are worn out and may have big holes on them. The carpet was the worst to me because it felt so dusty even though they vacuumed regularly. In a hotel like this, the people make the difference. The first morning -after a very long flight- we were late for breakfast. The lady who is in charge didn't even mind bringing all the food and stuff back from the kitchen, just for us! And the continental breakfast was much better compared to ones I had before. It contained Bagels, Danish, bread, jelly, Peanut butter, cream cheese and butter. There was always good coffee available in the breakfast / reception area of the hotel. I enjoyed going there in the evenings to have coffee while watching the news on the big screen. We had to change our room to a deluxe and this was no problem either. As soon as a room became available, they gave us a deluxe room. I believe Raza is the guy behind the success of this hotel. He is a real problem solver. He does his best to make your stay a pleasent one... Also, the location of the hotel is good with restaurants and even Publix market all in walking distance. If you feel like having a really big breakfast or any other meal, just a few steps from the hotel is the Bob Evans where you can have some great food served by wonderful ladies there. The shuttle company Metro, which they have contract with, is not a very good one. We tried only once and took a cab the next days. Roundtrip to Magic Kingdom costs USD 40.00, from airport to hotel costs USD 45.00 As a result, when you pay less, you expect less, so this hotel is a friendly budget hotel with clean sheets, good breakfast and nice people. I may go back there again in the future and hope they change their carpets soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel. Unheated pool!”
Reviews.Author: munchie11
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here before but was disappointed that the pool is now unheated. They are offering a free breakfast, which is acceptable, but the seating arrangements are chaotic. No coffee makers or hairdryers in the room. A reasonable hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Staff Makes It Special”
Reviews.Author: dep410
Reviews.Content: We have been traveling for 30 years and we travel with two small pets so we have to stay in pet friendly hotels! We ran across this Red Roof because we wanted to stay in the Orlando area for a change. On check-in we were greeted by a super friendly Raza at the desk who couldn't do enough for us; he was so cordial, polite and had a great sense of humor! The whole staff was smiling and friendly which made us feel great! Then, about a week later we met Demetri at the front desk who treated us like Raza did who also had a great personality! They treated all of their customers the same way and stayed so cool and calm under pressure; always had that smile! We extended our stay several times, met some great people, great pool, spa which made for a very memorable vacation! We will return next year and have recommended it to two other fellow travelers!! Thank you everyone! You're great!!

Reviews.Title: “Most accommodating hosts”
Reviews.Author: cherylpozniak
Reviews.Content: This Red Roof Inn offers not only the normal amenities, but the hosts are very friendly and helpful. I felt like they consider every guest individually versus being treated like just another customer. We will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Red Roof Inn Ever”
Reviews.Author: Arwen_Windwalker
Reviews.Content: Pros: friendly front desk staff convenient location such as close to restaurants ect. cons: we had to be moved to another room cause a pipe under the sink broke and soaked the carpet and stunk up the room. dirty smelly room stained carpet,I would not walk barefoot on this carpet if I were you. the guest laundry room was less than to be desired,DONT USE IT,it will rip you off,didnt dry clothes right after putting 3 dollars in machine kids running up and down the breezeway making noise waking us up. shifty characters. I would park kind of far from other cars or you will wind up with a dented car. if you can afford it,stay elsewhere,trust me you will be better off,trust me.

Reviews.Title: “best price, location, staff and room!”
Reviews.Author: Welovetravel760
Reviews.Content: My family and I booked two rooms last minute and we were extremely happy with Red Roof Inn! We were super close to so many restaurants, shopping and only a short shuttle ride (which Red Roof provides!) to Disneyworld parks!! Check in was easy and staff was friendly, they even booked a taxi for us ahead of time for us to get to the airport. Room was clean, housekeeping prompt and our room had fridge and microwave. We would all stay here again when we come back!

Reviews.Title: “my best trip with my family in my life”
Reviews.Author: red_rose_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my family from 11/9/2010 till 11/17/2010. We had a reservation. We had to came from another state, we were very late and unfortunately we forgot the way, then i called to red roof inn kissimmee ,there was a guy whose name was SUNNY, was really very nice who guided us very well, and due to his guidness, we reached at 1:00 am in hotel, We had alot of stuff, he checked us in suite room,and then after that he directed us very well for our room. The room was very clean and comfortable.Price was also reasonable, Service was also very good and other staff was also very helpfull. We like this hotel and specially the guy SUNNY,because he helped us alot.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, affordable, great service, brand new feel!”
Reviews.Author: Phustle
Reviews.Content: As a person who is frequently traveling for work, this hotel is a breath of fresh air. Everytime I come the rooms are always clean and the service is top notch unlike some of their neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: nscherm
Reviews.Content: Great Value. We planned a last minute trip and I booked this through Priceline. The staff was great and the room was clean and comfortable. I was very happy with the free WiFi as I had been charged for this at a more expensive hotel. I enjoyed the ground floor room I was giving when we checked in after midnight. The staff gave great driving directions and checkin was smooth. The best part was that the staff was extremely helpful when I realized I had left my earrings while waiting to board a rollar coaster. I called and they sent someone immediately to the room and immediately called me back. They kept them for me and I picked them up. Never have I had a hotel find something left and offer such service in getting the item back. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: lls929
Reviews.Content: Have enjoyed previous stays with Red Roof Inns. This is a "bare minimun" red roof inn. The room I had (109) has peeling paint in the bathrooms, rust on fire sprinkler, no towels or tv remote upon check-in, microwave did not work and coffee machine in lobby also out of order. Good think I'm only staying for one night. I would not return to this location.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised with the service and value”
Reviews.Author: samieandlily
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Red roof inn with my 2 very young girls and we had a wonderful time. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful, you cant go on vacation with kids without knowing where all the different stores are and they helped me find everything. The room was very nice and very clean, newly remodeled bathrooms and lots of towels, another necessary this with little ones, the room was also very spacious and we had an attatched living room with a 2nd bathroom, very helpful with a potty training toddler. The outside of the hotel was clean and quiet, and the pool was very nice. Overall I was very pleased with my stay and I will be sure to stay there again on my next trip .

Reviews.Title: “Value for $ is best, no one can beat. Best price, location, service, and clean.”
Reviews.Author: mail2jungsab
Reviews.Content: The new management has greatly improved the service and quality , and yet kept the lowest prices amongst the competition. I have made 3 visits since June 2010 and have experienced progressive improvement in quality and service, and more value for the buck. Location is great, swimming pool was clean and excellent staff - very helpful. There has been some positive change every time I visit. It gives an opportunity to save on hotel expenses for a comparable service from competition, the savings can be wisely spent on other essentials and entertainment during the travel. Wi-Fi is working fine no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Best location & best price”
Reviews.Author: bill1993
Reviews.Content: The price they charge for room....is nothing, absolutely free....every one can efford this hotel surrounding.....with all kind of resturant and shopping area and free trip to parks.....and in morning breakfast....they have everything even u dont need to take lunch.....the people are nice and friendly....we had a very good time...and we miss that palce....

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEl EVER!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Snuggles123
Reviews.Content: This room was a disaster BROKEN EVERYTHING even the toilet was smashed! Tub was creaking, bed was horrible, found medication under blanket which led me to believe was not clean linen, tv didn't work rpoperly, and ac unit was pure filthy and loud, staff admitingly placed us in thsi romm knowing itbhad problems and offered NO assistance when we checked out! I would not recommend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Red roof inn KISSIMMEE is comfortble, best location and very very reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: aliharoon61
Reviews.Content: Res roof Inn Kissimmee is best location with very reasonable price.All kind of food and shopping areas are around and free shuttle to all parks .We enjoyed the swimming pool and hot tube.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it for the money”
Reviews.Author: jpdzme
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to sleep that is inexpensive, clean, comfortable and bugless, this is probably the best value you will find in this part of Florida. Management was responsive to a problem we had with the tv, the maids were there every day, the room was clean and bright, but basic. You get a towel and face cloth per person and no coffee pot. You can upgrade to a suite, but I went for the least expensive room. Very convenient to shopping, restaurants and the parks. Quiet, friendly and responsive. It just doesn't get any better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good place, good service”
Reviews.Author: Papito44
Reviews.Content: The service was great. The front desk clerks are outstanding. The room was very clean and never had any problems with towels. Beds are very good. Location is great. Pizza Hut, Bob Evans and Taco Bell are in the same parking lot. Publix, BK are across the street. Free shuttle to Disney and Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the Value”
Reviews.Author: kjaussies
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this past weekend. Friendly Staff but the beds were uncomfortable and the showers were in need of repair. Good place to stay with pets as there was not an additional fee for them and good walking area. Great price just need to update the tv's in the room and pillows and beds...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: Bakerswife1989
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 room suite. We were 3 adults and 2 children and a 10 week old kitten. The rooms were clean, staff was wonderful. The new management seems to be getting things c hanged up from previous reviews. Give them a shot. They are about 5 minutes from Disney and worth the $$ for sure. $51 a night...can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap...”
Reviews.Author: E-man1979
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at different locations in kissimmee,192, before and this is by far worst experience ever. The room we stayed at, had a horrible smell, no phone, the floor on the outside had lime all over it, the sheets itched, no wifi, had to asked for an iron at front desk because ownership was afraid of people stealing it!!! The only good thing is that the clerks did everything to accomodate us in another room. But still I'm never spending a night here again...its cheap,in the worst kind of way

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, friendly staff, however slightly stale smell in all rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: ajax-hercules
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are spacious and clean, with sheets etc being changed. The pool is also clean and usable, however no change room at the pool side - so you have to manage or walk out wet to your room. Many stores / restaurants in walking distance making it quite convenient to plan breakfast , dinner etc.

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: tamrd4
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we had to wait 30 min. for the desk clerk to return in order to check us in. Carpet was nasty and ripped away at rooms entrance. Bathroom had "hair" all over the floor. Pool was full of leaves also.

Reviews.Title: “WTF ... OMG what was I thinking?”
Reviews.Author: TravelinUndertaker
Reviews.Content: OK, let me say this to boot, it was great for a one night I need to crash stay but at length. Orland sucked this particular weekend because it rained and was cold. No one was interested in the pool but if I had been there in May when it was pool weather and I needed to use the bathroom, I would have prob pee'ed in the pool. The Bathroom by the pool, which btw I was directed to use it before check in, looked like Beirut vs Iraq vs Hong Kong Gorilla. The room was clean, tub was great but can someone explain the RV just sitting outside. Its an RV from the 70's at that. It looked like the boogie man lived there. Again, one night ... Take it, just dont get in the pool and need to Pee. And have a cross close by in the event the boogie man jumps out of the RV from 70's Scoobie Doo.

Reviews.Title: “not treated right at this red roof”
Reviews.Author: morrisVeroBeachFl
Reviews.Content: been to this hotel several times and I noticed the attitude of the mgr and the staff very discourteous went to get a cup of coffee in the lobby and was told very curtly for registered guests only its the last ime I stay there

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, lovely staff, cold pool.”
Reviews.Author: munchie11
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on a number of occasions and was really disappointed this time with the unheated pool (advertised as heated) which had considerable vegetation debris in it. The price is right and the rooms are clean (except for grubby carpet) and well furnished. Well situated back from the main 192. Friendly staff. OK for short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it”
Reviews.Author: indiana006
Reviews.Content: I guess you get what you pay for. This hotel was suppose to be a 3star but it was no where near that. the bathroom was nasty, the room smelled, and the remote to the television did not work the whole time. instead the manager had to give us the master remote. there were strange knocks at the doors at 3in the morning. it was terrible. the breakfast included a basket of muffins and fruits at the checkin counter. you even have to pay for the internet service. its not included. It was TERRIBLE. the staff were ok but damn it never again will i stay here

Reviews.Title: “No Frills - Just Right”
Reviews.Author: JAXTRAVELER80
Reviews.Content: We paid a rate of 49.99 a night for the room, last minute on Daytona 500/ Presidents Day weekend. So it was a good deal. Only a couple little things -- the remote did not work to the TV, the bathtub had a slime feel to it, and the light blew right when we walked in the door. The light by the road way half lit up so it was a little hard to find. I wouldnt stay there again but if your looking for value, its your spot! Friendly staff, amazing housekeeping staff. You get what you pay for.

HotelInfo.Name: Red Roof Inn Kissimmee - Lake Buena Vista South
HotelInfo.Address: 4970 Kyng's Heath Road, Kissimmee, FL 34746
